page.title: 03MR FIELDHOUSE'S VISIT
page.content: { Mr Fieldhouse is 72, has lived in Hove Edge all his life, and went to our school. He came to St Chad's to talk about the history of the district. The school was built in 1894, and was used as a church as well, until St Chad's Church was built in 1912. When he was a boy, there were very few houses. In those days most local people worked in the quarries. Whilst in school, all day long he could hear the noise from them, and of the trams which ran along Upper Green Lane. Once, Mr Fieldhouse was caned for climbing onto the school roof to retrieve a football. Children were often caned in those days. Gradually, over the years, the district became more residential and more and more, people went to work out of the district.
